meanings.definition: A system of shorthand writing using a limited set of symbols to represent words or phrases.
meanings.sent1: In courtrooms, stenotypes help stenographers write down everything quickly.
meanings.sent2: The stenotypes allowed the secretary to take notes at lightning speed.
meanings.sent3: The stenotypes were so efficient that the writer finished the novel in record time.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like stenotypes, capturing thoughts in swift symbols.
meanings.sent5: Learning stenotypes is like learning a secret code for writing.

meanings.definition: The act or process of transcribing spoken words into stenographic symbols.
meanings.sent1: The stenotypes of the speech were meticulously transcribed for the record.
meanings.sent2: After the lecture, the stenotypes were converted into readable text.
meanings.sent3: The stenotypes danced across the page, turning speech into art.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers moved like stenotypes, transforming words into symbols effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The stenotypes captured the essence of the conversation with precision.

meanings.definition: A stenographic machine used for rapid transcription of spoken words.
meanings.sent1: The stenotypes hummed softly as they transcribed the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The stenotypes were essential for the journalist to meet tight deadlines.
meanings.sent3: The stenotypes chattered away, turning speech into text in seconds.
meanings.sent4: The stenotypes worked tirelessly, converting words into symbols without pause.
meanings.sent5: With the stenotypes, the reporter could capture every word spoken.
